title: Feb 27, 2026
summary: Homepage reorganized with IB Trading Tools branding, Manual Trading v2 with inline order ticket and net greeks, and Event Driven Portfolio gains Curate + Monitor tabs.

features.title: IB Trading Tools Rebrand
features.summary: M&A Options Scanner renamed to IB Trading Tools with restructured tabs: Manual, Manual v2, and Algorithmic.
features.description:
The homepage card formerly labeled "M&A Options Scanner" is now "IB Trading Tools" to better reflect its evolved scope.

**Tab restructure:** The Curate and Monitor tabs (event-driven portfolio curation) have moved to the Event Driven Portfolio page where they belong. The IB Trading Tools page now has three focused tabs:
- **Manual** — The original Account tab (IBPositionsTab), unchanged
- **Manual v2** — New inline trading interface with net greeks (see below)
- **Algorithmic** — The Signals tab for BMC execution controls

The permission key remains "ma-options" so no user permission changes are needed.

features.title: Manual Trading v2 — Inline Everything
features.summary: New trading interface: sortable ticker table with net greeks, full-page detail view, and inline order ticket with zero popups.
features.description:
A complete redesign of the manual trading workflow, purpose-built for accessibility. Every interaction happens inline — no modals, no overlays, no X buttons to find.

**Ticker Summary Table:**
- All positions grouped by underlying ticker in a sortable table
- Columns: Stock position, Options count, Spot price, Notional value, Net Delta, Net Gamma, Net Theta, P&L
- Click any column header to sort (ascending/descending toggle)
- Inline add-ticker row with SEC EDGAR autocomplete (no modal)
- Column chooser for customizing visible columns

**Ticker Detail View:**
- Click any ticker row to enter a full-page detail view
- "← Back to positions" button (large, clear text, no X icon)
- Greek summary strip: Net Δ, Stock Δ, Options Δ, Net Γ, Net Θ, Net V
- Position legs table showing all STK + OPT positions with per-leg delta
- Click an option leg to pre-fill the order ticket with that contract
- Working orders filtered to just this ticker, with inline edit/cancel

**Inline Order Ticket:**
- Rendered in the page flow, not as a fixed overlay
- BUY/SELL toggle with large color-coded buttons (52px+)
- Order types: LMT, STP LMT, MOC
- Quantity input (text-4xl) with delta buttons (+1, +2, +5, +10, +25, +50, +100)
- Price input (text-4xl) with delta buttons (±0.01, ±0.05, ±0.10, ±0.25, ±0.50)
- Delta sign (+/−) toggle, TIF (DAY/GTC), Outside RTH toggle
- **Inline confirmation**: Submit → ticket transitions to confirmation state showing order summary + "Confirm [BUY/SELL] — Send Order" / Cancel buttons. No dialog popup.

**Greeks Pipeline:**
- Delta, gamma, theta, vega, and implied volatility now flow from IB through the agent → relay → frontend pipeline
- Net delta = stock_qty + Σ(option_qty × contract_delta × 100)
- Greeks show "—" when unavailable (Polygon source or IB disconnected)

The v1 Manual tab is preserved unchanged as an A/B reference.

features.title: Event Driven Portfolio Gains Curate + Monitor
features.summary: The Curate and Monitor tabs now live under the Event Driven Portfolio page, with the existing portfolio view as the default tab.
features.description:
The Event Driven Portfolio page now has three tabs:
- **Portfolio** (default) — The existing deal table with live prices, risk grades, and AI assessments
- **Curate** — Deal selector, option chain viewer, and candidate strategy builder (moved from M&A Options Scanner)
- **Monitor** — Watched spreads with live price monitoring (moved from M&A Options Scanner)

The page now uses a server/client architecture: the server component fetches scanner deals from Prisma, while the client component wraps everything in IBConnectionProvider so Curate and Monitor tabs can access IB data.

This reorganization puts event-driven portfolio curation tools where they logically belong — alongside the portfolio data they operate on.
